title: Cropping of videos interactively and through config file

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
Windows 7, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut 2.0.5

**Describe the problem**
Cropping of videos is not working.
When executing this command :
deeplabcut.extract_frames(config_path,'automatic','kmeans',crop=True)

Then I am asked whether I want to extract frames from a given video and I type 'yes' in.

It opens up a figure in which I can interactively draw a rectangle over my arena. But how can I accept that drawn form? I cannot find any button for that and also no keyboard input does the job. 

The opened figure looks like this
![cropping_fig](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36044114/63773972-9504f080-c8dc-11e9-9af0-11b9873bf665.png)

Also this note pops up: C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\dlc36\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\frame_extraction.py:100: YAMLLoadWarning: calling yaml.load() without Loader=... is deprecated, as the default Loader is unsafe. Please read https://msg.pyyaml.org/load for full details.
  cfg = yaml.load(ymlfile)

I also tried by inputting the correct values into the config.yaml file but it does not do the cropping.

Do you know a solution to this? Or what the easiest procedure for cropping would be. 

Thanks,
Isa
